WorkItem.ClosedComment: Try to upgrade to latest version of PHPExcel, version 1.7.4 has just been released.
WorkItem.Description: I have version 1.7.0 and currently works on all operating systems except windows 7. It says the excel file is corrupt and it requires you to fix it.
WorkItem.Summary: phpexcel in windows 7 with corrupt message

Comments.Message: A bit more detail would be useful. I'm running PHPExcel on Windows 7 without problem. What version of PHP are you running? |Do you have all necessary modules (e.g. php_zip) enabled. What format are you writing (Excel5 or Excel2007)? What version of Excel are you using to try and open the generated file?

Also, if you are using Excel5 writer, the problem is likely fixed:
http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=10059

Try to upgrade to latest version of PHPExcel and see if problem persists.

I'm using PHPExcel 1.7.6 and CodeIgniter 1.7 and having to deal with this issue.

I've tried both Excel5 and Excel2007 writers and got the same result.

I'm not sure if this is the problem causing the "file corrupt" message, but opening the file in Notepad++, I was able to detect that at the very begining of the generated file there are two special characters, the tab and the newline character, in this exact order "\t\n". If I remove those characters, Excel opens the file flawlessly and without that creepy message.

BTW... I'm using Windows 7 with Excel 2007 and tried on another pc with Windows 7 and Excel 2010.

I've attached a file generated with Excel5 writer and having test data (just a bunch of strings repeated in every cell)
